Title: üñº The BRICS summit began in Kazan. The event became the most rep...
Description: The BRICS summit began in Kazan. The event became the most representative from the point of view of the leaders of countries who arrived in Russia after the start of the war in UkraineFormally, the BRICS summit opens in Kazan on October 22 and ends on October 24, but official events began today. According to Vladimir Putin's assistant Yuri Ushakov, 36 delegations from states and six from international organizations will attend the summit. Of the leaders of the group's member countries, only Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, who had previously suffered a head injury, did not attend the summit. So, the leaders of the BRICS member countries, namely China, India, South Africa, as well as Egypt, Iran, the UAE and Ethiopia, which joined on January 1, 2024, came to the summit.  Among those who arrived in Kazan was the deputy head of the Hamas Politburo Musa Abu Marzuk, the leader of Republika Srpska, which is part of Bosnia and Herzegovina Milorad Dodik, the heads of Azerbaijan, Armenia, Mongolia, Belarus, Congo, Laos, Kyrgyzstan, Kazakhstan and others states, as well as the President of NATO member Turkey, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, and UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres. At the summit, a list of 13 candidate countries was agreed upon, but it was not disclosed. Also at the event, Putin was shown the proposed single currency of the BRICS member countries, although the head of the Central Bank, Elvira Nabiullina, did not value the banknote. The Economist wrote that one of the main objectives of this summit was the construction of a new global financial and payment system called BRICS Bridge, which is designed to -deal a blow to the US dominance in world finance- and -to protect Russia and its friends from sanctions-. The publication notes that this system will allow countries to conduct cross-border settlements using digital platforms managed by their central banks. Russia plans to build it within a year. At the same time, Kremlin press secretary Dmitry Peskov argued that cooperation within the BRICS framework -is not directed against anyone or anything‚Äîneither against the dollar, nor against other currencies.-

Title: üñº Moscow conscripts were forced to sign a form with access to st...
Description: Moscow conscripts were forced to sign a form with access to state secrets Moscow college student told -Conscript School- that he and about 20 other young people were invited to the Unified Recruitment Point (EPP) in Moscow to -clarify military registration data,- where they received a questionnaire in which they were asked to sign under the clause on access to state secrets and responsibility for their dissemination. But this should only happen with the consent of the citizen. The exception is conscripts. They may be allowed access to state secrets without consent, since the military unit itself may be secret. The conscripts do not touch any state secrets,- human rights activists note. -Getting access to state secrets means that the military registration and enlistment office will have one more reason to make threats. Title: Meduza gained access to the correspondence of employees of IK-6, ...
Description: Meduza gained access to the correspondence of employees of IK-6, where Navalny was imprisoned. The letters indicate conditions of detention that were specially tightened for the politician - falsification of documents, censorship and a punishment cell for rolling up sleevesIn early August, the publication received from a source an archive of correspondence from employees of IK-6 (a maximum security colony in the village of Melekhovo Vladimir region, where Alexei Navalny spent most of his time), namely messages from the email of Ilya Kruglyshev, a lawyer who represented in the courts a maximum security penal colony in the village of Melekhovo. Letters about Navalny from his correspondence were sent out from May 2021 to February 2024. From today's publications it became clear: - In IK-6, documents were falsified to respond to Navalny‚Äôs claims about violations in the colony. For example, at the end of 2023, after Navalny disappeared, representatives of the Federal Penitentiary Service first explained his disappearance by power outages in the colony, then the lawyers were informed that the politician was no longer in IK-6. Three weeks later it turned out that he was transferred to a special regime colony in the village of Kharp in the Yamalo-Nenets Autonomous Okrug, where he was subsequently killed. After this, the head of IK-6, Dmitry Nozhkin, reported on the reasons for Navalny‚Äôs transfer, saying that he was transferred to Kharp due to the entry into force of a new sentence. However, in the first version of the document signed by Nozhkin, something else was stated - the reason for Navalny‚Äôs stage was the instruction of the Federal Penitentiary Service of Russia No. 02-6477-dsp (-for official use-) received by IK-6. By excluding this instruction from the final version, the colony staff were able to hide it from the lawyers.- The colony staff closely monitored the lawyers and read all the letters that Navalny sent and received, especially after the posts appeared online on behalf of Navalny, information from which was not mentioned in the wiretapped conversations between the politician and his wife and mother. Then the workers of IK-6 concluded that Navalny was transmitting the text for publication to his associates through lawyers. In response, the employees sealed the transparent plexiglass covering the grille that separated lawyers and clients in the room where their meetings take place, and got rid of a special slot for the transfer of documents, which is why Navalny‚Äôs lawyers could not transfer to him the materials of new criminal cases cases brought against the politician while he was in prison. And the lawyers also could not show these papers.- Navalny recorded a noticeable increase in blood pressure - 140/90. Such readings could be a sign of arterial hypertension and a reason for starting drug therapy. Navalny was not prescribed medications to lower blood pressure in IK-6. According to the official version of Navalny‚Äôs death, it was the -critical increase in blood pressure- that became the -trigger- for the development of the -combined disease-, which allegedly led to the death of the politician in February 2024. - Navalny was held in a punishment cell more than 300 days in two years. On one occasion, he was sent there because he rolled up the sleeves of his robe, which was several sizes too small for him. Each time, before this punishment, prisoners must be examined by doctors - Navalny complained of pain in his back, stomach and hands, but he was still sent to the isolation ward. - April 17, 2023, two employees of IK-6 ;‚Äî Alexey Kukushkin and Vladimir Katalev beat Navalny because he -categorically refused to enter the cell- of the punishment cell. After the beating, as Meduza writes, Navalny was escorted to the cell where the convicted A.A. Tatarchenko, who was specially put in the same cell with Navalny, since Tatarchenko was homeless and did not take care of hygiene, which made it impossible to be in the same room with him.- In October 2023, Navalny told his lawyer Olga Mikhailova that -it seems like I‚Äôm being bullied here.- About the possible poisoning of Navalny in the colony also statedThe Insider journalists, who claimed that before Navalny‚Äôs death he was vomiting and complained of -sharp pain in the abdominal area.- However, this information disappeared from the official document about the causes of Navalny‚Äôs death.

Moreover, in January 2024 alone, the enterprise produced more than 90 thousand tons.

Title: üñº In Moldova, during the presidential elections, no one was able...
Description: In the presidential elections in Moldova, no one was able to overcome the 50% threshold - the country will hold a second round. Meanwhile, supporters of the union are losing in the referendum on joining the EUPresidential elections were held in the Republic of Moldova on Sunday. There are 11 politicians vying for the presidency, including incumbent President Maia Sandu. After processing about 80% of the protocols, she gained 36% of the votes, in second place is the candidate from the Party of Socialists (PSRM) Alexandru Stoianoglo with 29%, in third place is Renato Usatii with 13%. Since none of the candidates passed the 50% threshold, the republic must undergo a second round of presidential elections. The current President of Moldova, Maia Sandu, is 52 years old and has served as president since 2022. In 2016, the politician founded the Action and Solidarity party (Partidul Ac»õiune »ôi Solidaritate - PAS), which a year later won early parliamentary elections and became the ruling party. She is a supporter of the republic joining the EUOn the same day, October 20, a referendum on the country's European integration was held in Moldova, which was supposed to determine whether membership in the European Union would become a strategic goal of the state, which would be spelled out in the Constitution. Voters received a referendum ballot along with the presidential election ballot. The question was formulated as follows:  -Do you support amending the Constitution in order for the Republic of Moldova to join the European Union?- and two answer options - -Yes- and -No-. After processing more than 50% of the ballots, the majority of voters were against European integration - about 55%, 44% of citizens were in favor of joining the EU, it follows from the preliminary results of the referendum, which are published by the country's Central Election Commission on its website site. There is currently no decision on either the second round of the presidential election or the result of the referendum.

The source said that on average, sending a 20-ton truck from Poland to Russia will cost 5.5 thousand dollars, and transportation of the same volume through Turkey will cost about 11 thousand dollars. This scheme, among others, is used by the Russian microelectronics supplier Kvazar, which has been under American sanctions since May 2023.
